title: Weekly snapshot of Chinese culture news
content:
BEIJING, Nov. 30 (Xinhua) -- The following are the highlights of China's key culture news from the past week:
-- Archeological discovery in W China unveils ancient cultural exchange along Silk Road
Chinese National Cultural Heritage Administration has released four archeological discoveries in western China, showcasing proof of cultural exchange along the ancient Silk Road.
The discoveries involved a military fortress in Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region, two tombs in Qinghai Province and one tomb in Gansu Province.
-- Chinese sci-fi comic strips to be published in France
A comic series based on Chinese science fiction writer Liu Cixin's acclaimed works will be published and distributed in France in succession during 2020 and 2021.
Close to 30 cartoonists from nine countries including China, France, the United States, Italy, Spain and Argentina will draw inspirations from Liu's 15 stories like "The Wandering Earth," "Ball Lightning," "The Micro-Age" and "Devourer" and create comics with international perspectives.
-- Beijing Forum for Symphonic Music 2019 held at NCPA
The Beijing Forum for Symphonic Music 2019, hosted by the National Center for the Performing Arts (NCPA), opened Tuesday.
Themed "Integration and Development," the three-day event attracted close to 200 guests from orchestras, art colleges and other institutions in 14 countries and regions to discuss opportunities and challenges of symphonic music. Enditem
